sen.j: 行基（ぎょうき／ぎょうぎ、天智天皇7年（668年） - 天平21年2月2日 (旧暦)（749年2月23日））は日本の奈良時代の僧である。
sen.e: Gyoki (or Gyogi, February 2, 668-February 23, 749 (old lunar calendar)) is a buhddist monk of Nara era in Japan.
Gyoki (or Gyogi, February 2, 668-February 23, 749 (old lunar calendar)) was a Buddhist monk of the Nara era in Japan.
Gyoki (or Gyogi, 668 - February 23, 749) was a Buddhist monk of the Nara era in Japan.

sen.j: 677年4月に生まれたという説もある。
sen.e: There is another theory that he was born in April 677.
There is another theory that he was born in April 677.
There is another theory that he was born in April 677.

sen.j: 父は百済系渡来人氏族の末裔西文氏（かわちのあやし）一族の高志才智とされる。
sen.e: His father is said to have been KOSHI no Saichi, who belonged to a Kawachi no Fumi clan, descendents of clans migrated from Kudara (Baekje; one of three kingdoms in southern Korean Peninsula in Ancient periods).
sen.cmt: 西文氏（かわちのあやし）→「かわちのふみうじ」のことと解釈しました。
sen.e: His father is said to have been KOSHI no Saichi, who belonged to a Kawachi no Fumi clan, descendents of clans that migrated from Kudara (Baekje; one of three kingdoms in the southern Korean Peninsula in Ancient periods).

It is said that his father was KOSHI no Saichi, who was a member of Kawachi no Fumi clan, descendents of those who had come from Kudara (Baekje; one of three kingdoms in the southern Korean Peninsula in Ancient periods).
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 母は河内国（のち和泉国）大鳥郡の蜂田首（現在の華林寺）の出。
sen.e: His mother was from Hachita no Obito (today's Keirin-ji Temple), Otori District, Kawachi Province (later Izumi Province).
His mother was from Hachita no Obito (today's Keirin-ji Temple), Otori District, Kawachi Province (later Izumi Province).
His mother was from Hachita no Obito (today's Keirin-ji Temple), Otori District, Kawachi Province (later Izumi Province).

sen.j: 河内国大鳥郡（現在の大阪府堺市）の生まれ。
sen.e: He was born in Otori District, Kawachi Province (today's Sakai City, Osaka Prefecture).
He was born in Otori District, Kawachi Province (today's Sakai City, Osaka Prefecture).
He was born in Otori District, Kawachi Province (Sakai City, Osaka Prefecture in present days).
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 681年に出家、官大寺で法相宗などの教学を学び、集団を形成して近畿地方を中心に貧民救済・治水・架橋などの社会事業に活動した。
sen.e: He entered in the priesthood in 681, learned the methods of education and learning such as Hosso sect at Kandai-ji Temple, and formed a new group to be committed to social activities including poor relief, flood control, and bridge construction mainly in Kinki Region.

He entered the priesthood in 681, learned the methods of education and learning such as Hosso sect at Kandai-ji Temple, and formed a new group committed to social activities, including relief for the poor, flood control, and bridge construction mainly in the Kinki Region.

He entered the priesthood in 681, learned the methods of education and learning such as Hosso sect at Kandai-ji Temple, and formed a new group committed to social activities, including relief for the poor, flood control, and bridge construction mainly in the Kinki Region.

sen.j: 704年に生家を家原寺としてそこに居住した。
sen.e: In 704, he made the house of his birth into Ebara-ji Temple, and started living there.
In 704, he made the house of his birth into Ebara-ji Temple, and started living there.
In 704, he changed the house of his birth into Ebara-ji Temple, which he made his residence.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 民衆を煽動する人物であり寺外の活動が「僧尼令」に違反するとし、養老元年4月23日_(旧暦)詔をもって糾弾されて弾圧を受けた。
sen.e: The Government cracked down on him through issuing an imperial decree dated April 23, 717 (old lunar calendar) for inciting public unrest and his activity as being against "Soni ryo" (Regulations for Monks and Nuns).

The Government cracked down on him by issuing an imperial decree dated April 23, 717 (old lunar calendar) for inciting public unrest and his activity as being against "Soni ryo" (Regulations for Monks and Nuns).

The Government criticized and suppressed him for swing public opinion and for his outside-temple activity violating 'Soni ryo' (Regulations for Monks and Nuns) under an imperial decree dated April 23, 717 (old lunar calendar).
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: だが、行基の指導による墾田開発や社会事業の進展や地方豪族や民衆らを中心とした教団の拡大を抑えきれなかったこと、行基の活動が政府が恐れていた「反政府」的な意図を有したものではないことから、731年（天平3年）禁圧を緩め、翌年河内の狭山下池の築造に行基の技術力や農民動員の力量を利用した。
sen.e: However, the fact that the Government could not stop the accelerating activities such as reclaimed land development and social work under the leadership of Gyoki, or permeation of the cult's influences into powerful local clans and general public, and that Gyoki's activities were not the ones that were intended to capsizing the Government, which they were afraid of; as a result, Government lessen the level of supression in 731, and made full use of Gyoki's powess in technological and labor gathering for the construction of Sayamashimoike in Kawachi in 732.

However, the fact that the Government could not stop the accelerating activities, such as reclaimed land development and social work under the leadership of Gyoki, or permeation of the cult's influences into powerful local clans and the general public, and that Gyoki's activities were not ones that were intended to capsize the Government, which they were afraid of, and as a result, the Government loosened the level of supression in 731, and made full use of Gyoki's powers in technological and labor gathering for the construction of Sayamashimoike in Kawachi in 732.

However, the government could not stop Gyoki leading the development of new rice field and other social activities, or the religious community mainly consisted of local clans and ordinary people; the goverment also recognized that Gyoki's activities did not have any 'anti-government' intentions, which the goverment feard; so, the government weakened the suppression in 731, and made full use of Gyoki's powers in technology and gathering peasants for the construction of Sayamashimo-ike Pond in Kawachi in 732.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しましたGyoki に統一用語修正

sen.j: 741年（天平13年）3月に聖武天皇が恭仁京郊外の泉橋院で行基と会見し、同15年東大寺の大仏造造営の勧進に起用されている。
sen.e: In March 741, Emperor Shomu met Gyoki at Senkyo-in Temple in the suburb of the ancient capital of Kuni-kyo, and he was designated as the Kanjin (position to collect donations for the temple) for the construction project of Great Buddha statue in Todai-ji Temple in 743.

In March 741, Emperor Shomu met Gyoki at Senkyo-in Temple in the suburb of the ancient capital of Kuni-kyo, and he was designated as the Kanjin (position to collect donations for the temple) for the construction project of the Great Buddha statue in Todai-ji Temple in 743.

On March 741Emperor Shomu met Gyoki at Senkyo-in Temple in the suburb of Kuni-kyo, and in 743 Gyogi was designated as the Kanjin (position to collect donations for the temple) for the construction the Great Buddha statue in Todai-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 勧進の効果は大きく、745年（天平17年）に朝廷より日本最初の大僧正の位を贈られた。
sen.e: Gyoki's made a great success in soliciting for contribution, and in 745, he received Dai-sojo (a buddhist priest of the highest order) from the Imperial Court for the first time in Japan.
Gyoki made a great success in soliciting for contributions, and in 745, he received Dai-sojo (a buddhist priest of the highest order) from the Imperial Court for the first time in Japan.
Gyoki made a great success in collecting donation for the contribution, and in 745, he was endowed with the first Japanese Dai-sojo (a buddhist priest of the highest order) from the Imperial Court.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 行基の活動と国家からの弾圧に関しては、奈良時代において具体的な僧尼令違反を理由に処分されたのは行基のみと言われている。
sen.e: With respect to Gyoki's activities and crack-down by the Government, it has been suggested that Gyoki was the only person who was punished for the reasons of being specifically against Soni ryo in Nara era.

With respect to Gyoki's activities and crack-down by the Government, it has been suggested that Gyoki was the only person who was punished for the reasons of being specifically against Soni ryo in the Nara era.
Regarding Gyoki's activities and being suppressed by the government, it is said that Gyoki was the only person that was punished explicitly for violating Soni ryo in the Nara period.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました用語修正

sen.j: そのため、それぞれに対して、同時代の中国で席捲していた三階教教団の活動と唐朝の弾圧との関連や影響関係が指摘されている。
sen.e: It was suspected, therefore, for the activities and crack-down by the Government, that there may have been relation to and influences of the activities of Sangaikyo (Sanjiejao), a cult dominated in the same period in China, and the crack-down by the Chinese Government

It was suspected, therefore, for the activities and crack-down by the Government, that there may have been relation to, and influence on, the activities of Sangaikyo (Sanjiejao), a cult that dominated in the same period in China, and the crack-down by the Tang Dynasty Government.

It was suspected, therefore, for the activities and crack-down by the Government, that there may have been relation to, and influence on, the activities of Sangaikyo (Sanjiejao), a cult that dominated in the same period in China, and the crack-down by the Tang Dynasty Government.

sen.j: 三世一身法が施行されると灌漑事業などをはじめ、前述の東大寺大仏造立にも関わっている。
sen.e: When Sanze-isshin Law (promoting reclamation) came into effect, Gyoki became involved in irrigation projects and construction of Great Buddha statue in Todai-ji Temple mentioned above.
When the Sanze-isshin Law (promoting reclamation) came into effect, Gyoki became involved in irrigation projects and construction of the Great Buddha statue in Todai-ji Temple mentioned above.
When the Sanze-isshin Law (promoting reclamation) was put into effect, Gyoki became involved in irrigation projects and the construction of the Great Buddha statue in Todai-ji Temple mentioned above.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 大仏造営中の天平21年2月2日、喜光寺で81歳で入滅し、生駒市の竹林寺 (生駒市)に墓所がある。
sen.e: Gyoki entered Nirvana (generallu called "death") at the age of 81 at Kiko-ji Temple on February 2, 749 during the construction of Great Buddha statue; his tomb is located in Chikurin-ji Temple (Ikoma City).

Gyoki entered Nirvana (generally called "death") at the age of 81 at Kiko-ji Temple on February 2, 749 during the construction of theGreat Buddha statue; his tomb is located in Chikurin-ji Temple (Ikoma City).
Gyoki entered Nirvana (passed away) at the age of 81at Kiko-ji Temple on February 2, 749, when the Great Buddha statue was being constructed; his tomb is in Chikurin-ji Temple (Ikoma City).
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: また、朝廷より菩薩の称号が下され、行基菩薩と言われる。
sen.e: Gyoki was also granted the title of "Bosatsu"(Bodhisattva) by the Imperial Court, and called "Gyoki Bosatsu."
Gyoki was also granted the title of "Bosatsu"(Bodhisattva) by the Imperial Court, and called "Gyoki Bosatsu."
The title of Bosatsu (Bodhisattva) was bestowed on Gyoki by the Imperial Court, and so he was called Gyoki Bosatsu.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 行基は畿内を中心とした各地で布教活動を行っていたことから、近畿地方を中心として各地に縁の地とされる土地が存在している。
sen.e: Because Gyoki's activities were based on Kinai region (the five capital provinces surrounding the ancient capitals of Nara and Kyoto); there are many places that are famous for their association with Gyoki in Kinki region and other places.

Because Gyoki's activities were based in the Kinai region (the five capital provinces surrounding the ancient capitals of Nara and Kyoto). There are many places that are famous for their association with Gyoki in the Kinki region and other places.

Because Gyoki promulgated Buddhism in various places, mainly in the Kinai region (the five capital provinces surrounding the ancient capitals of Nara and Kyoto), there are a lot of places associated with him in the Kinki region as well as other places.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 生家跡は知恵の文殊菩薩を本尊とすることから合格祈願で有名な家原寺となっている。
sen.e: The house where Gyoki was born is now Ebara-ji Temple, which is famous for praying for success in entrance examination because the temple's honzon (principal image of Buddha) is Monju Bosatsu (Manjusri), who embodies enlightened wisdom.

The house where Gyoki was born is now Ebara-ji Temple, which is famous for praying for success in entrance examinations because the temple's honzon (principal image of Buddha) is Monju Bosatsu (Manjusri), who embodies enlightened wisdom.

The house where Gyoki was born has turned into Ebara-ji Temple, which is famous for many people's praying for success in entrance examinations because the temple's Honzon (principal image of Buddha) is Monju Bosatsu (Manjusri), who is believed to embody wisdom.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しましたentrance→entrance examinations

sen.j: 大阪府高石市高師浜3丁目付近で生まれたと言う説もあり、「行基生誕の地」の石碑が建てられている。
sen.e: There is a theory that Gyoki was born near 3 cho-me, Takashinohama, Takaishi City, Osaka Prefecture, where there is a stone monument inscribed as "Birthplace of Gyoki."
There is a theory that Gyoki was born near 3 cho-me, Takashinohama, Takaishi City, Osaka Prefecture, where there is a stone monument inscribed as "Birthplace of Gyoki."
Another theory says that Gyoki was born near 3 cho-me, Takashinohama, Takaishi City, Osaka Prefecture, where there is a stone monument inscribed with 'Birthplace of Gyoki.'
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: その石碑には、「行基に連なる大工集団が千歯扱きを考案した、その大工集団は幕末まで京都御所の御用大工となった、高度な大工技術を駆使して高石地区の住宅建設を請け負っていた」と刻まれている。
sen.e: The inscription of the monument reads "a group of carpenters related to Gyoki designed a threshing machine, the group became official carpenters for Kyoto Imperial Palace until the end of Edo era, and commissioned residencial construction in Takaishi District making full use of their high carpentry skills."

The inscription of the monument reads "a group of carpenters related to Gyoki designed a threshing machine, the group became official carpenters for Kyoto Imperial Palace until the end of the Edo era, and commissioned residential construction in Takaishi District making full use of their carpentry skills."

The inscription of the monument reads 'a group of carpenters related to Gyoki designed a threshing machine, the group became official carpenters for Kyoto Imperial Palace until the end of the Edo era, and commissioned residential construction in Takaishi District making full use of their carpentry skills.'

sen.j: なお、これらの功績により、この付近が「匠」と呼ばれている。
sen.e: Because of the successful achievements, the area is called "Takumi"(craft master); the community hall built in the supposed birthplace of Gyoki is called "Takumi Hall (or Hachiku Hall)."
Because of the successful achievements, the area is called "Takumi"(craft master). The community hall built in the supposed birthplace of Gyoki is called "Takumi Hall (or Hachiku Hall)."
Because of the successful achievements, the area is called 'Takumi' (craft master).
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合わせ"を'に一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: 行基生誕伝承のある地に建てられた自治会館が「匠会館（八区会館）」と呼ばれている。
sen.e: The community hall built in the supposed birthplace of Gyoki is called 'Takumi Hall (or Hachiku Hall).'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: 近鉄奈良駅の入口前には陶製（赤膚焼）の行基の像があり、奈良市ではよく知られた待ち合わせ場所になっている。
sen.e: A red Akahadayaki pottery Gyoki statue is standing at the front of the entrance gate of Nara Station of Kintetsu Railway, providing a popular waiting spot well known in Nara City areas.
A red Akahadayaki pottery Gyoki statue is standing at the front of the entrance gate of Kintetsu Nara Station, providing a popular meeting spot well known in the Nara City area.
In front of the entrance gate of Kintetsu Nara Station stands a Gyoki statue made of red Akahadayaki pottery, providing a popular meeting spot in the Nara City.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 大阪府岸和田市の祭礼だんじり祭では、行基が開山した龍臥山隆池院久米田寺に周辺地区の地車が集結する。
sen.e: Kishiwada Danjiri Matsuri Festival, decorative portable shrines of the districts gather in Ryuchi-in Kumeda-dera Temple Mt. Ryugasan, which was founded by Gyoki.
Kishiwada Danjiri Matsuri Festival, decorative portable shrines of the districts gather in Ryuchi-in Kumeda-dera Temple Mt. Ryugasan, which was founded by Gyoki.
In the Danjiri Matsuri Festival in Kishiwada, Osaka prefecture, decorated portable shrines of the local districts gather in Ryuchi-in Kumeda-dera Temple, Mt. Ryugasan, which was founded by Gyoki.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: これは、久米田寺の前に位置する久米田池を行基が掘削指導し、田畑の開墾や周辺住民の生活向上へ寄与し、その他の遺徳を顕彰する「行基参り」と呼ばれている。
sen.e: This is called "Gyoki mairi (visit),"which celebrates Gyoki's numerous achievements including his guidance in the excavation of Kumeda-ike Pond located at the front of Kumeda-dera Temple, resulted in the significant contribution to the development of farm land and improvement of the local residents' life.

This is called "Gyoki mairi (visit),"which celebrates Gyoki's numerous achievements including his guidance in the excavation of Kumeda-ike Pond located at the front of Kumeda-dera Temple, which resulted in significant contributions to the development of farm land and improvements in local residents' life.

This gathering is called 'Gyoki mairi (visit),' which celebrates Gyoki's numerous achievements including his leadership in excavating Kumeda-ike Pond located in front of Kumeda-dera Temple; the excavation greatly contributied to the development of farm lands and the improvement of the lives of the local people.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 兵庫県伊丹市の昆陽池公園の園内施設には行基の偉業や胸像が設置されている。
sen.e: In the facility at Koyaike koen Park in Itami City, Hyogo Prefecture, Gyoki's achievements and a bust statue are displayed.
In the facility at Koyaike koen Park in Itami City, Hyogo Prefecture, Gyoki's achievements and a bust statue are displayed.
In the facility at Koyaike koen Park in Itami City, Hyogo Prefecture, Gyoki's achievements and a bust statue are displayed.

sen.j: 昆陽池の南南東1キロほどの場所に行基の開基した昆陽寺がある。
sen.e: Koya-dera Temple, which was founded by Gyoki, is located 1 km south south-east of Koyaike Pond.
Koya-dera Temple, which was founded by Gyoki, is located 1km south south-east of Koyaike Pond.
Koya-dera Temple, which was founded by Gyoki, is located about 1km from Koya-ike Pond in a south-southeasterly direction.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました大文字にしました

sen.j: 市内には行基町（ぎょうぎちょう）という地名がある。
sen.e: In Itami City, there is a town named Gyogi-cho.
In Itami City, there is a town named Gyogi-cho.
In Itami City, there is a geographical name of Gyogi-cho.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました
